content:
TITLE: Configuring Datadog SDK Credentials in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet contains the configuration for Datadog SDK initialization, including client token, environment, application ID, and API call link.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation-async/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "clientToken": "<CLIENT_TOKEN>",
    "environment": "<ENVIRONMENT_NAME>",
    "applicationId": "<RUM_APPLICATION_ID>",
    "apiCall": "<ApiLink>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog Credentials in React Native
DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for the credentials.json file, containing Datadog client token, environment name, and RUM application ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "clientToken": "<CLIENT_TOKEN>",
  "environment": "<ENVIRONMENT_NAME>",
  "applicationId": "<RUM_APPLICATION_ID>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog Credentials
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration file structure for Datadog credentials including application ID, client token, and environment settings. These credentials are required for Datadog instrumentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-native-tvos/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "applicationId": "<your-application-id>",
  "clientToken": "<your-client-token>",
  "environment": "<your-environment>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Credentials for React Native Codepush and Datadog RUM
DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for the credentials.json file, including Datadog client token, environment, RUM application ID, and Codepush deployment keys for Android and iOS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation-codepush/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "clientToken": "<CLIENT_TOKEN>",
    "environment": "<ENVIRONMENT_NAME>",
    "applicationId": "<RUM_APPLICATION_ID>",
    "CodePushDeploymentKeyAndroid": "<CodePushDeploymentKeyAndroid>",
    "CodePushDeploymentKeyIOS": "<CodePushDeploymentKeyIOS>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog Credentials for React Native App
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for Datadog credentials that should be placed in a credentials.json file at the project root. It requires the application ID, client token, and environment values from your Datadog account.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rn-app-with-native/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "applicationId": "<your-application-id>",
  "clientToken": "<your-client-token>",
  "environment": "<your-environment>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog Credentials
DESCRIPTION: Sample configuration file content for setting up Datadog monitoring with application ID, client token, and environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/android-app-with-rn/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: properties
CODE:
```
APPLICATION_ID="<your-application-id>"
CLIENT_TOKEN="<your-client-token>"
ENVIRONMENT="<env>"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog Credentials
DESCRIPTION: Configuration file setup for Datadog credentials including application ID, client token, and environment settings in the iOS app configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/ios-app-with-rn/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: properties
CODE:
```
APPLICATION_ID = <your-application-id>
CLIENT_TOKEN = <your-client-token>
ENVIRONMENT = <env>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog Credentials in JSON
DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for Datadog configuration including client token, environment, and RUM application ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-expo-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "clientToken": "<CLIENT_TOKEN>",
  "environment": "<ENVIRONMENT_NAME>",
  "applicationId": "<RUM_APPLICATION_ID>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog SDK Initialization Parameters in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows an example of additional Datadog initialization parameters, including session sampling rate and native crash report settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation-async/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "sessionSamplingRate": 60,
    "nativeCrashReportEnabled": true
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog API Key for Source Map Uploads
DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for the datadog-ci.json file, containing the Datadog API key required for uploading source maps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation-codepush/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "apiKey":"<YOUR_DATADOG_API_KEY>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog CI for Sourcemap Upload in React Native
DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for the datadog-ci.json file, containing the Datadog API key for sourcemap uploads.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "apiKey": "<YOUR_DATADOG_API_KEY>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datadog CI for Sourcemap Upload in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet contains the configuration for uploading sourcemaps to Datadog, including the Datadog API key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation-async/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "apiKey":"<YOUR_DATADOG_API_KEY>"
}
```

TITLE: Fixing React Native Screens Build Issue
DESCRIPTION: Code modification required to fix a known issue with react-native-screens integration in existing Android applications. This change modifies the theme attribute resolution in ScreenStackHeaderConfig.kt.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/android-app-with-rn/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
if (context.theme.resolveAttribute(android.R.attr.colorPrimary, tv, true)) {
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting API Host for Shopist in React Native
DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for the hosts.json file, specifying the Shopist API host.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "shopistApiHost": "shopist.io"
}
```

----------------------------------------

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "shopistApiHost": "shopist.io"
}
```

TITLE: Configuring API Host in JSON
DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for defining the API host for the Shopist service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-expo-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "shopistApiHost": "shopist.io"

```

TITLE: Configuring API Host for Shopist in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet contains the configuration for the Shopist API host.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation-async/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json

{
    "shopistApiHost": "shopist.io"

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for React Native Datadog SDK
DESCRIPTION: This shell command installs all necessary dependencies for the project and sets up CocoaPods for iOS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation-async/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn install
(cd ios && pod install)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running React Native Example Apps
DESCRIPTION: Commands to run the Android and iOS sample applications after setup. These commands should be executed from the project root directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
# Run the Android sample
yarn android

# Run the ios sample
yarn ios
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for React Native Datadog Integration
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install project dependencies and CocoaPods for iOS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn install
(cd ios && pod install)
```

----------------------------------------

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn install
(cd ios && pod install)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for React Native Codepush Project

SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-navigation-codepush/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

CODE:
```

(cd ios && pod install)
```

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for React Native App with Native Screens
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install all necessary dependencies for the React Native application. This includes installing JavaScript dependencies with yarn and iOS dependencies with CocoaPods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rn-app-with-native/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn install
(cd ios && pod install)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for React Native iOS App
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install the required dependencies using yarn and CocoaPods for the iOS portion of the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/ios-app-with-rn/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn install
(cd ios && pod install)
```

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Expo App
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install project dependencies and CocoaPods for iOS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-expo-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn install
(cd ios && pod install)
```

TITLE: Building Expo App for Android
DESCRIPTION: Command to build and run the Expo app on Android using expo-dev-client.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-expo-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn expo run:android
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Expo App for iOS
DESCRIPTION: Command to build and run the Expo app on iOS using expo-dev-client.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-expo-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn expo run:ios
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Yarn
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all project dependencies using Yarn package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/android-app-with-rn/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running tvOS App
DESCRIPTION: Command to launch the React Native app on a tvOS simulator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-native-tvos/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn tvos
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Encoding Configuration Files for EAS Secrets
DESCRIPTION: Commands to base64 encode configuration files for use as EAS secrets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-expo-react-navigation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cat ./credentials.json | base64
cat ./config/credentials.json | base64
cat ./config/hosts.json | base64
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring CMake for React Native TV Application with New Architecture
DESCRIPTION: Sets up the minimum CMake version, defines the project name for a TV app, and includes the React Native application cmake utilities required for building with the New Architecture. The configuration is minimal but sufficient to prepare the build environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/datadog/dd-sdk-reactnative-examples/blob/main/rum-react-native-tvos/android/app/src/main/jni/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13)

# Define the library name here.
project(tvapp_appmodules)

# This file includes all the necessary to let you build your application with the New Architecture.
include(${REACT_ANDROID_DIR}/cmake-utils/ReactNative-application.cmake)
```
